lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/stewie.stewie.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run stewie.stewie.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

**Stewie** is a desktop application that helps you manage your tasks with a sarcastic flair, packaged in a clean and minimalist GUI. :D
- **Persistent Storage:** Tasks are automatically saved and loaded from disk.
Add tasks for Stewie to keep track of! There are three types:
General task with no date or time.
Creates a Todo Task named “Buy groceries”.
Task that must be completed by a certain date.
Creates a Deadline Task named “Submit report” due on 1st March 2026.
Event with tentative slots. You can confirm one slot later.
Creates an Event Task named “Team meeting” with tentative slots on 20th and 21st February 2026.
List all tasks that have been added.
Search for a specific task by its name (case-insensitive).
Task indices can be found from `list` or `find` commands.
Removes Task 2 from the list. Task 3 now becomes index 2.
Closes Stewie and **saves all tasks to disk** automatically.
Stewie automatically saves all tasks to a file (`stewie.txt`) in your `data/` folder.
- When the app starts, it loads all tasks from the file.
- When you add, mark, unmark, or delete tasks, the file is updated automatically.
- This ensures your tasks persist between sessions.
* Represents a command to add a new task to the task list.
* When executed, this command adds the specified Task to the provided TaskList,
* updates the UI with confirmation messages, and saves the updated list to storage.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the task to be added.
* @param task The Task object to add to the task list
* Adds the task to the list, displays messages via the UI, and saves
* the updated task list to the storage file.
* @param tasks   The TaskList to which the task will be added
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display messages
* @param storage The Storage instance used to persist tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("Failed to save tasks to disk.");
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);

System.out.println("Invalid date format! Use yyyy-MM-dd. Storing as plain string.");

* Returns the deadline date as a LocalDate object.

* displays confirmation messages via the UI, and saves the updated list to storage.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand for a specific task index.

* Removes the task at the specified index, updates the UI with messages,
* and attempts to save the updated task list to storage.
* If the index is invalid, an error is displayed.
* @param tasks   TaskList from which a task will be removed
* @param ui      UI instance used to display messages
* @param storage Storage instance used to persist the task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
ui.showError("Failed to save tasks to disk.");
* Represents an event task with one or more tentative slots.
* An Event task has a description and a list of possible time slots.
* One of the slots can be confirmed as the final event time.
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
* Constructs an Event task with a description and list of tentative slots.
* @param slots       List of tentative time slots; must not be null or empty
* @throws AssertionError if slots is null or empty
assert slots != null : "Slots list should not be null";
assert !slots.isEmpty() : "Event must have at least one slot";
* Returns the type identifier of this task.
* Confirms one of the tentative slots as the final event time.
* @param index Index of the slot to confirm (0-based)
* @throws AssertionError if index is out of bounds
: "Slot index must be within valid range";
* Returns true if a slot has been confirmed.
* Returns a string representation of the task suitable for saving to a file.
* Returns a human-readable string representation of this task.
* Represents the command to exit the chatbot.
* When executed, this command signals the chatbot to terminate its main loop
* and optionally displays a farewell message to the user.
* Displays a farewell message using the provided UI.
* @param tasks   The current TaskList (not modified by this command)
* @param ui      The UI instance to display messages
* @param storage The storage instance (not modified by this command)
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Goodbye! Very well. Run along now. I have schemes to attend to.");
* Indicates that this command is an exit command.
* @return true, because this command ends the chatbot session
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

this.message = "I do not understand your pathetic command.";

* Represents the command to list all tasks in the TaskList.

* @param ui      The UI instance to display messages

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

ui.showMessage("Here are the tasks in your list:");
